document.title: Content Standards and Grade Level Expectations English Program 2022

E01E209EBB36427AB3EB26B81D92286A.description: Accurately use basic conversational, general, academic, and content area words and phrases.

EA43401148154FE3B03CC838B4A989EC.description:
Accurately use a variety of social, academic, and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing,
speaking, and listening at the college and career-readiness level.

6DD36934813C4D0CA976586C616E6679.description:
Distinguish meaning among closely related verbs (e.g., toss, throw, hurl) and closely related
adjectives (e.g., thin, slender, skinny).

B94C6F12628945448901BD24DDC4044B.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their usage (e.g., describe people who are
friendly or helpful).

FD4DFCB638034432A750C51298CC26D2.description:
Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., to take
steps).

119EAA8453A145DDABD302710EFD3AE8.description: Identify figurative language, word relationships, and differences in word meanings.

5F58FDE8334F401B82DBDF302C099F9A.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

BC4B64F2EEA941B9A31D4CD74D9CC64E.description:
Use glossaries and beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the
meaning of words and phrases.

AC231DCC49294B498B03BDF55F471C96.description:
Use knowledge of the meaning of individual words to determine the meaning of compound
words (e.g., birdhouse/lighthouse/housefly, bookshelf/notebook/bookmark).

97863E38EAB04F2B95D59B1F333AACA2.description:
Identify frequently occurring root words (e.g., look) and their inflectional forms (e.g.,
looks/looked/looking).

3356FC9C26F44BBF9C65F81D90C88D14.description:
Determine the meaning of the new word that is formed when a prefix is added to a known
word (e.g., happy/unhappy, tell/retell).

912CBD8ABEE144BA9DEA71B9ABAB77E5.description:
Use the most frequently occurring suffixes (e.g., -s, -ed, -ing, -ful, -less) as clues to the
meaning of an unknown word.

80A39FEB050A47A3B1CE4F81C2175F4D.description: Use context clues to help determine the meaning of a word or phrase.

642EF8FA759B4DF98619994752E6A41E.description:
Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing that a
duck is a bird and learning the verb “to duck”).

F8D4C9161A5345C2BB7A6065D33D0D06.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on class reading
and content area study, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

D5330785995A414C8DAA825C52891206.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts,
and consulting reference materials.

968C1765346B4E73B63E861D06F19EB9.description:
With support, apply differences between the conventions of spoken and written English with
some degree of accuracy though not perfectly.

3DA1943899ED4849933EE207037AFDA9.description:
Choose words and phrases for different purposes (e.g., slang, written vs. spoken, formal vs.
informal).

BB6103B996974F3FA9120F0386255D19.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

B4451E234B3E467CA6A28E99C3361F39.description:
Demonstrate understanding of how language functions in different contexts, making effective choices for meaning, style,
and comprehension.

2B5830D5F8A94D379EB62A5B55C002D9.description:
Consult reference materials, including dictionaries, as needed to find words alphabetically and
to check and correct spelling.

E20737BF78B049808A08B395200BBFB1.description:
Use spelling patterns and generalizations (e.g., word families, position-based spellings,
syllable patterns, ending rules, meaningful word parts) when writing words.

23DAC4ECAF804CFE88CBBE16E854BCC5.description:
Use conventional spelling for high-frequency and other studied words and for adding suffixes
to base words (e.g., sitting, smiled, cries, happiness).

BF3656664C91412FA9FF38B24CAB88B4.description: Use commas in greetings and closings of letters. Use quotation marks in dialogue.

C342D56C264246B79BE568CF814F8F8F.description: Use punctuation for declarative, imperative, interrogative, and exclamatory sentences.

7A91AA13818A4E6BA67B7F5919416D29.description: Demonstrate command of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions when writing.

6E69B2DF31BD40FB98D679AFC6DF6079.description: Apply appropriate English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions.

6951313F76CD47399BC8592540AF395C.description: Use frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., during, beyond, toward).

2CF44BD62C034C4F8DBCDADD71EF5C92.description:
Produce, expand, and rearrange complete simple and compound sentences (e.g., The boy watched the movie. / The little boy watched the movie. / The action movie was watched by
the little boy.).

9F146D9CD61243BE9315AAF4515B9BA5.description:
Combine two simple sentences to make a compound sentence by adding “and," "but," or
"because."

8237B50E0142476586AED43700788795.description:
Form and apply the appropriate comparative and superlative adjectives (e.g., good, better,
best) to modify a noun.

5DC95BCAA0C749508B69D42AFFA51517.description:
Form and apply the simple present, past, and future verb tenses (e.g., I walk. / I walked. / I
will walk.).

FB7D34D3C76342D693D7414E879E8DDC.description: Form and apply regular and irregular verbs.

9FD5E247BCDC4BEF95158343CEA341CB.description: Use an apostrophe to form contractions and frequently occurring possessives.

C04183D273EA402A81DD5AA745B9191A.description: Form and use irregular plural nouns.

F82DD844AFBE480E84A6EA558EBDF86A.description: Form and use regular plural nouns.

8FD18EF3118144ED9C5D3E8E59FC82A6.description:
Use nouns, verbs, adjectives, and adverbs in increasingly complex grammatically correct
sentences.

E559E136A6094009A479E8E8B758861B.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions when writing or speaking.

C21AD1710A23460199E5A0F082B1B418.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

8117F05562F1456EA9CC8997C2B68F05.description:
Conduct research to gather information that answers a question about a single topic and
audience.

A9E7CA1A108E4BD9BC270DF7809FB60C.description:
Write routinely over short periods of time (a single sitting or 1–2 days) for a variety of discipline-specific tasks
and purposes.

D815626981464360AEC6ADC66F050067.description: Write routinely over short and extended periods of time for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

7669986058144042A50AAEE21FD80FA3.description:
Analyze information from literary and informational texts and digital resources to draw evidence needed to
answer a question in writing.

C02CC3AC5A33442A97E3B70812C0F27C.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

DE9148B61F9542298663BA5EAC09DA60.description:
As part of a writing project, participate in collaborative research on a given topic (e.g., how-to books) and use
this to write a sequence of instructions.

2F717C6A58F9405B8C4DA070EC7ED29D.description: Conduct research projects of varying lengths based on focused questions to demonstrate understanding of the subject.

BDBAA833616647F7B6C8C103F7E7346E.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (e.g., use
the internet to gather information or a word processor to generate and collaborate on writing).

17A2C85CAD1A4AE0927E28296E6F1358.description: Use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

18D0D7E93BAF4ABAB587AA7013CADD47.description: Use technology, including the internet, to interact and collaborate with others and produce and publish writing.

4986DDE56E064D6F95E405BF102C5CE3.description:
Focus on a topic, respond to questions and suggestions from peers, and add details to strengthen writing as
needed.

6B6C3FA923FE445E8C6A47BC80233AD1.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, rewriting, and
publishing).

39A09239876D43C18837FBE002B90FB2.description:
Write literary texts (stories, poems) and answer open-ended questions with increasing independence using appropriate text organization, transitional words, and other cohesive devices to better organize writing in
paragraphs of 4 or more sentences. (Include 4 or more words per sentence.)

32110FC2192F487DB4C89B6CCA57CF8C.description: Write literary texts to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, details, and structure.

2803857FC5AD49CE96251DA3C459E8E5.description:
Write informational texts (e.g., how-to books, simple reports) and answer open-ended questions with increasing
independence and organize key ideas and details in paragraphs of 4 or more sentences. (Include 4 or more words per sentence.)

24D1164B0BD243A7A49576E0155C14DF.description:
Write informational texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the
selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

C45426C9CF0D4BCB989CDAF712E4F951.description:
Offer and support ideas, feelings, opinions on familiar topics, experiences, or grade-appropriate texts, providing
textual evidence or adding relevant background knowledge on the subject matter in paragraphs of 4 or more sentences. (Include 4 or more words per sentence.)

1D26F6E91AB94D5CB6CBE1B223EC95F4.description: Write arguments to support point of view using valid reasoning and relevant evidence.

EA3220E08D264E8D8487E824A8F5BD96.description:
Read and comprehend narratives, stories, biographies, autobiographies, realistic fiction, and other types of
passages of appropriate complexity.

635C261A06D842DFBC444957AF32576D.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

8DB785B5D11443459C3CE0B170A8D086.description:
Compare and contrast basic similarities and differences between two informational texts on the
same topic (e.g., illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

2CF73B295F804D5989BB7D6AB2759595.description: Compare and contrast two or more versions of the same story (e.g., Cinderella stories) by different authors, from different cultures, or from different time periods.

CFC65C2779F342CD9EE3E11EDF4018D8.description: Compare and contrast 2 or more authors’ presentations of similar themes or topics.

5B7C655263004D08A48366D6F1696242.description: Describe how reasons support specific points the author makes in a text, including, but not limited to, narrative, persuasive, and descriptive writing and knowledge of their qualities.

1FE1C4857BB34EDEA5953A2DEB8A7394.description: Delineate and evaluate an author’s argument through evidence specified in a text.

D2398F1596D64A2E87AD16D6BD8DFA9D.description: Explain how specific images (e.g., a diagram showing how a machine works) contribute to and clarify an informational text.

E5C50E6772D341EEA92BCA8CB48663F9.description: Evaluate information gained from the illustrations and words in a print or digital literary text to demonstrate understanding of its characters, setting, or plot.

B87D19894EF74E3AB0532878BF647681.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats.

FD55A5398BDC43008E12F090E3152741.description: Identify the main purpose of an informational text, including what the author wants to answer, explain, or describe.

F90F2DA47DAA4FFA87AEE7A31277E28D.description: Acknowledge differences in the points of view of characters, including by speaking in a different voice for each character when reading dialogue aloud.

DF699F1DD6CE48F2B10A237F025B8EB0.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

8D34AA2479484BCF911D880A84A7A9B9.description: Use various text features (e.g., captions, bold print, subheadings, glossaries, indexes, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in an informational text efficiently.

680B7CB79F154723BD8560B79D7AD22E.description:
Understand and use various text features (e.g., headings, tables of contents, glossaries, digital menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a literary text. Describe how the beginning introduces the story and the ending concludes the action (story organization: beginning, middle,
and end).

C671CD6F90E744F19B6F2BB9FF7C882C.description: Analyze the structure of a text, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., sections, chapters, scenes, or stanzas) relate to each other and to the whole.

7A9C39AA1CB74E6BA9F7EA5690A14BEF.description: Determine the meaning of unknown words, concepts, and phrases and/or use illustrations to help clarify their meaning in an informational text.

820ED1934EE241928C97B1B1D32E9659.description: Describe how words and phrases (e.g., regular beats, alliteration, rhymes, repeated lines) supply rhythm and meaning to a story, poem, or song.

7DC082BA06554C379D755B0E2F9E3E29.description:
Determine the meaning of unknown words and phrases, and/or use illustrations to help clarify its
meaning in a literary text.

29D352E80DBD4699B4DC82BDE24AB459.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings. Analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

931ADC932C4342849F7E78012C62256C.description: Explain the connection between a series of historical events, scientific ideas, concepts, or technical procedures in an informational text.

27FD0D2B589B4D038081480FE44274C9.description: Explain how characters in a story respond to major events and challenges.

139FF5E7B0A84D9F84748AC98631B303.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

686E74158BB3446E8232020629686819.description:
Identify the main topic of a multi-paragraph informational text and the focus of specific paragraphs
within the text.

01770019570F4C12B0EAC1601C8D662A.description: Identify the main topic and summarize key details of an informational text.

12827DABB7B24C7796F0508ABBE098D9.description:
Recount stories, including fables or folktales from diverse cultures, and determine the main idea,
lesson, or moral and the supporting details.

AB89CD3E4A634AC6906CA6A970FE8ABD.description: Determine main ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development. Summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

FA985426195241529F1CA495BE51F773.description: Identify facts/details that support main idea(s) from the texts.

1F65AA6D968041489F579AB004E9F07F.description:
Ask and answer questions (Who?, What?, Where?, When?, Why?, How?) to demonstrate
understanding of key details in a text.

FF91C1000DAA49EB88F04D36BEB1E607.description: Use in-depth critical reading of a variety of relevant texts or viewing of multimedia resources to describe ideas, phenomena, cultural identities, and literary elements in the texts.

91325D0B45BC4896830EF2A334148943.description: Read critically to make logical inferences and cite specific textual evidence to support conclusions drawn from the text.

1BD67F8036B04261B7F7D338269E7E76.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

35D6DF8DCC594345AFC5CEE5F24F0E49.description:
Accurately read on-level prose and poetry orally with appropriate rate and expression on successive
readings.

7BD526990D824A8DB42FA2C1277AABB9.description: Read on-level texts with purpose and understanding.

1E57E6AB69F549F2A269D611AA2B605B.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

9635257E2C0E40DD987C0D05DE232B73.description: Read (100–150) high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

4AF66D4DE10E493584531A5926465921.description: Recognize and read grade-appropriate regularly spelled words.

01D8D4DFA3794B57A1AC21738C6BFD3B.description: Decode words with common Latin suffixes and prefixes.

AC43684592D6410487544B1E127BB950.description: Identify and understand the meaning of the most common prefixes and derivational suffixes.

CABCE2BDB84542B999BE525255C13378.description:
Understand and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to decode short and long sound patterns and their
variants both in isolation and in text.

FD9A286670A94BD0800F932698490BC4.description:
Segment spoken monosyllabic words into their complete sequence of individual sounds
(phonemes).

43DEE9A2EE49406C8C048CD20E958555.description:
With support and prompting, isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds
(phonemes) in spoken monosyllabic words.

F6CC7CC314C9436EA089CDDDD5A9EDDE.description: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken monosyllabic words.

F177BB99E0BD43DBB22EB3029ED81388.description: Orally produce monosyllabic words by blending sounds (phonemes), including consonant blends.

57083D91EFE24320BC7DF484EC6D2BC5.description:
Manipulate sounds and words in shared, guided, and independent activities, such as singing,
chanting, or participating in finger plays.

541AFE7928DD42B1BBD99B4B558637FE.description: Recognize, generate, and produce rhyming words, including nonsense words.

46030C7AC5AD4C92A064A54F66D84DD0.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

46D73094EC5C49CFB0EE2A3DC446D444.description: Phonological awareness (rhyming, blending, segmentation, deletion, isolation, substitution)

F4A646A8CF7343CAA6F4AD0E3FB88986.description: Recognize relevant information from multiple print and digital sources.

F9784E7C012E41CFAD9F65E35388C5A4.description: Apply the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending punctuation).

175945376342485D94269DD309A56C31.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

E0E836C6092A47FDB9EAA3DF60C26901.description:
Retell a story, explain a science process, report on a current event, analyze a poem, or recount a
memorable experience using general content-specific words.

CCBE8AD062CB46F1B5E925076CB36C77.description:
Retell and summarize familiar stories or short informational texts and recount experiences using complete sentences, reflecting a logical sequence, key words, and a growing number of academic and content‐specific words to add important details or establish the main idea. Use visual displays,
digital resources, or illustrations.

2D5C0ABD4B76424083DEE2E44267141D.description:
Plan and deliver brief oral presentations on a variety of familiar topics using illustrations, digital resources, words,
phrases, or vocabulary from a text (e.g., integrating print or technological/digital resources).

361A5797D0BA40D6B0BB7F1D5227D47E.description:
Plan and deliver different types of oral presentations/reports to express information and support ideas in social, academic,
college, and career settings.

226637A8FEB3407E825B3998C553632B.description:
Describe personal experiences or ideas from a fictional or informational text, choosing appropriate language
according to purpose, context, and audience and using grade-appropriate grammar.

8ECF5DC75EE54CF09999488CE6649B61.description: Adjust language choices according to the task, context, purpose, and audience.

F0D84120EEF64248B4B32D69D423E163.description:
Plan and deliver an informational/explanatory presentation that organizes ideas around major
points of information, follows a logical sequence, includes supporting details, uses clear and specific vocabulary, and provides a strong conclusion.

9BE804300B174441893E9CFBC3FEB651.description:
Explain and interpret statements, opinions, or arguments with increasing independence using
language models or sentence starters (prompts).

A2FC242D647946BDA69F690C66C0A1D9.description:
Share and reinforce ideas and opinions by providing good reasoning and detailed text evidence and/or relevant
background knowledge on the subject matter.

915F4FCFFD6A42359E57C8C86A0A5B45.description: Provide, justify, and defend opinions or positions in speech.

08E9CEC191BB4721A2C266DA82A533F4.description:
Explain fictional and Informational texts, conversations, read-alouds, and presentations. Use complete sentences
and key words to add detail while speaking. Use expanded vocabulary and descriptive words.

4A3BCB39A4844C329427E9F6B39DBF1B.description: Contribute to social, academic, college, and career conversations using accurate and appropriate language.

BE3EE2D9E61644E5B969C42B6D1AC35B.description:
Expand sentences to provide details. (e.g., They worked quietly. / They ran across the soccer
field.) in shared language activities.

0A3D4E1A923740C7A83E06F411061D3C.description:
Use correct grammar in expanded simple sentences to express ideas for a variety of purposes, to
respond to simple instructions, and to answer and formulate questions.

FFCAF90034E4453B9954609758670ABD.description:
Use and apply common social greetings, retell texts, and recount experiences using increasingly detailed complete
sentences.

0FB2D021C324481BB0F380F1EDF400A0.description: Evaluate information and determine appropriate responses to answer questions effectively.

6C41546DC87A4CB38302A854C4DFA3FF.description: Listen and respond to simple instructions.

F045AD38A6C04303A7FDB661E2E41E74.description: Respond orally to closed- and open-ended questions.

1B8A4134698D4C65B95B98B691B3A183.description: Interact in class, group, and partner discussions by following rules, asking and answering questions, and adding relevant information.

20BDB484A5E6479B8DB0F98DEDA3D0BF.description:
Contribute to discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics in diverse contexts and with different
audiences.

EDACC58DB5D14B229F1CDF266976D698.description: Repeat and respond to chants, poems, songs, and rhymes using phrases, physical movements, etc.

39EC8D802FA247A39AE82466838BD024.description: Offer and respond to greetings/farewells using appropriate courtesy expressions.

ECE90FA145184A7EAE02767B530A4069.description: Listen and respond to increasingly complex commands and directions.

99658A5B6DCC41D485910B8993763BF8.description:
Use verbal and nonverbal forms and simple sentences to demonstrate engagement and
understanding in a socially appropriate manner.

023CA57CC2784E5B94A1264D875F9DFC.description:
Ask and answer detailed questions that stimulate conversation. Refer to details from the text as the basis for opinions and conclusions. Use appropriate language structure according to purpose
and setting (formal and informal).

7F74224C8372495784D27843000F3859.description: Listen and respond to simple 5W and 1H questions.

8377E2355A5E458E926B55830D0B103E.description:
Listen to and interact with peers during social interactions; read-alouds (fiction and nonfiction texts); oral
presentations; and class, group, and partner discussions.

E772E3B903E047FA9DAD954570C165D6.description:
Comprehend and analyze information from a variety of listening activities to ask and answer questions on social, academic,
college, and career topics.

3C56974A15144189BEABB5F36501975F.description: Listen and respond to simple instructions.

AB760FDC3197413182CC4E1DADEEDD0F.description: Respond orally to closed- and open-ended questions.

03E1D15B967F4849AC59E52D63BB6F9D.description: Interact in class, group, and partner discussions by following rules, asking and answering questions, and adding relevant information.

A0636D89F3B044A5BAA732DF288C4F92.description:
Contribute to discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics in diverse contexts and with different
audiences.

C7F807A521774E44BB9836CB40C48710.description: Repeat and respond to chants, poems, songs, and rhymes using phrases, physical movements, etc.

04D46C5092DE40EF8D5C592613B811F3.description: Offer and respond to greetings/farewells using appropriate courtesy expressions.

1ACAC8C55C7E4BDB9FCB5C81B9EB758D.description: Listen and respond to increasingly complex commands and directions.

316979963DDA491DB996B92535CFDE01.description:
Use verbal and nonverbal forms and simple sentences to demonstrate engagement and
understanding in a socially appropriate manner.

79ECC8964D2C463888B9E0F0C16957D4.description:
Ask and answer detailed questions that stimulate conversation. Refer to details from the text as the basis for opinions and conclusions. Use appropriate language structure according to purpose
and setting (formal and informal).

65A1F69D25684BF4AFA4B6D27A25F0C3.description: Listen and respond to simple 5W and 1H questions.

DBF812C87E9B47A5ABC04237D6BDAB1E.description:
Listen to and interact with peers during social interactions; read-alouds (fiction and nonfiction texts); oral
presentations; and class, group, and partner discussions.

F74D46DD4B144CFDA6F407D3AFE0E6D6.description:
Comprehend and analyze information from a variety of listening activities to ask and answer questions on social, academic,
college, and career topics.
